description: From New Latin anacandaia (“python”) [originally referring to a species of constrictor found in Sri Lanka], from Sinhalese හෙනකඳයා (henakaⁿdayā, “whip snake”), from හෙන (hena, “lightning, thunderbolt”) + කඳ (kaⁿda, “stem, trunk, body”).

entries.meaning: Any of various large nonvenomous snakes of the genus Eunectes, found mainly in northern South America. [from 19th c.]
(in particular) The green anaconda; Eunectes murinus.
(by extension, slang, vulgar) A large penis.
examples: My anaconda don't want none / Unless you got buns, hon
